Q1: What is the main plot of The Fuller Brush Man?
A1: The Fuller Brush Man is a 1948 American comedy film about a door-to-door salesman for the Fuller Brush Company who becomes a murder suspect.

Q2: Who stars in The Fuller Brush Man?
A2: Red Skelton, Janet Blair, Don McGuire, Hillary Brooke, Ross Ford, Trudy Marshall, and Nicholas Joy.

Q3: What is the setting of The Fuller Brush Man?
A3: The film takes place in an unspecified city and suburbs, likely in the United States.

Q4: What is the conflict in The Fuller Brush Man?
A4: The main conflict is between Red Jones (played by Red Skelton) and Keenan Wallick (played by Don McGuire), who are competing for Ann Elliott's (played by Janet Blair) affections, while also trying to sell Fuller Brush products.

Q5: What is the resolution of The Fuller Brush Man?
A5: Red Jones is cleared of murder charges and wins Ann's heart in the end.

Q6: What is the significance of the Fuller Brush Company in The Fuller Brush Man?
A6: The Fuller Brush Company is a major plot point, as the characters sell their products door-to-door, and the company gives Red Jones an opportunity to prove himself as a salesman.

Q7: How does The Fuller Brush Man relate to other films of its time?
A7: The film was produced during a time when commercial tie-ins were becoming more common in feature films, such as Miracle on 34th Street (1947), which showed the benefits of commercial tie-ins.

Q8: What is the production history of The Fuller Brush Man?
A8: The project had been in development for four years, and producer Simon secured funding from Columbia Pictures conditional upon MGM agreeing to loan him out. Producer Edward Small was owed a favor by MGM, and he agreed not to make a film called D'Artagnan to clash with their production of The Three Musketeers (1948).

Q9: What are some notable cast members in The Fuller Brush Man?
A9: Red Skelton, Janet Blair, Don McGuire, Hillary Brooke, Ross Ford, Trudy Marshall, and Nicholas Joy are all notable cast members.

Q10: How does The Fuller Brush Man relate to other films by the same producer or studio?
A10: The film was produced by Columbia Pictures, which was known for producing comedies and musicals during this time period. Producer Simon also produced other successful films, such as Miracle on 34th Street (1947) and Scrooge (1951).

Q1: What was Bill Porter's occupation?
A1: Bill Porter was a salesman for Watkins Incorporated based out of Winona, Minnesota.

Q2: Where was Bill Porter born?
A2: Bill Porter was born in San Francisco, California.

Q3: What was Porter's background brought to the public's attention in 1995?
A3: An Oregon-based newspaper published a series of feature stories about Porter in 1995, highlighting his optimistic determination and work ethic despite being born with cerebral palsy.

Q4: How long did Porter work for Watkins Incorporated?
A4: Bill Porter worked for Watkins Incorporated for over forty years as a door-to-door salesman.

Q5: What was the name of the TV movie based on Bill Porter's life?
A5: The TV movie based on Bill Porter's life was called "Door to Door" and was aired in 2009 on TBS network in Japan.

Q6: Who played the role of Bill Porter in the TV movie "Door to Door"?
A6: The role of Bill Porter in the TV movie "Door to Door" was played by Ninomiya Kazunari and Rosa Kato.

Q7: When did Bill Porter pass away?
A7: Bill Porter passed away on December 3, 2013, at the age of 81, due to an infection in Gresham, Oregon.

Q8: How many phone calls and letters did the 20/20 broadcast receive after featuring Bill Porter?
A8: The 20/20 broadcast featuring Bill Porter received over 2000 phone calls and letters, which was the most ever for a 20/20 story.

Q9: Was Bill Porter born with cerebral palsy?
A9: Yes, Bill Porter was born with cerebral palsy.

Q10: How did Bill Porter convince Watkins Incorporated to give him a door-to-door salesman job?
A10: Despite being unable to gain employment due to his cerebral palsy, Bill Porter refused to go on disability and convinced Watkins Incorporated to give him a door-to-door salesman job.
